column4: anyways, i know that there is a way to make this card work with ndiswrapper, because i had it working... but with linux, if one thing is not screwed up, then three things are
anyone who oes on about linux being so much more stable than windows is on crack
goes*
Stop trolling.. feel free to go back to M$
i am not trolling, i have just had a lot of bad luck  the last 2 weeks.... so stuff it
i do not appreciate you saying i was trolling either
i never said i didnt like linux, i am frustrated. please do not talk to me... i have been working on this broadcom card for a week, and i am just messing things up more
i have been given no link to any fix
may i send you a private message?
It can be done.. yes
would you know of any doc that would cover such a thing?
http://users.bigpond.net.au/hermanzone/SuperGrubDiskPage.html   may come in handy
THe super grub reapir works easier when adding a second drive. etc..
You can always use windows to come back and ask questions
i can see how that would probably be the case. i will probably give that a try
It is a bootable cd that checks all drives and combinations of os's and trys to set them up for you
i think that is exactly what i need
Kinda thought so..
and thanks for our discussion earlier
more than welcome
